alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 28 at 3:46AM MST until March 01 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11AM THIS MORNING THROUGH 6PM THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS, MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, AND SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO VERY WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY LATE MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EARLY EVENING FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO VERY WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS... .Winds will strengthen again Tuesday across much of the area and the combination of windy and dry conditions will bring several hours of critical fire weather conditions to portions of the eastern plains, along with portions of the Middle Rio Grande Valley and Sandia and Manzano Mountains. Dry and windy conditions will return on Wednesday across the east central plains, allowing critical fire weather conditions to potentially return for several hours. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EARLY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...For the warning, East Central Plains (Zone 126) from 11 AM this morning through 6 PM MST this evening. For the watch, East Central Plains (Zone 126) from Tuesday late morning through Tuesday early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph today. Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph on Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent today and Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and Fire Weather Watch.
